title: Fleshslasher
author: Fleshslasher
content: hey,I noticed that my one of my old accounts got hacked he changed my email and password. i think its being hacked for some years now. The account name is tam31. I noticed he uses my style of posting haha. the account was orginally created in the Netherlands but i think now that the ip is changed totally in the security logs. Can a mod help me out?https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=1138263

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: If you previously posted an address with that account, and you can sign a message from it, you can follow these steps[1].[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5089777.0

comments.author: Fleshslasher
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on January 30, 2023, 03:58:34 PMIf you previously posted an address with that account, and you can sign a message from it, you can follow these steps[1].[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5089777.0 i lost the access to the too email but i can provide a eth address that i used on the tam31 account

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Your claim isn't enough just to read the IP during registration. I don't remember about my account, I think it was created using not my country's IP to avoid getting filtered by IP evils.Quote from: OmegaStarScream on January 30, 2023, 03:58:34 PMIf you previously posted an address with that account,Nothing, the OP never posted any crypto addresses.Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:08:00 PMi lost the access to the too email but i can provide a eth address that i used on the tam31 accountMaybe I missed something, did you ever post that address with that account?

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 03:55:51 PMhey,I noticed that my one of my old accounts got hacked he changed my email and password. i think its being hacked for some years now. The account name is tam31. I noticed he uses my style of posting haha. the account was orginally created in the Netherlands but i think now that the ip is changed totally in the security logs. Can a mod help me out?I have checked BTC or Ethereum address you used ever in this forum but I did not find anyone. It will be better to provide some more information like when you post last message here and also You must have received the email change mail in your previous Email. You should provide this screenshot here so that moderators see your case properly.Quote https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=1138263 This account is created in 2017 and still active and style of posting is same like earlier posts. it is very difficult to find out when it was hacked because there are two big breaks, June-2018 to Mar 2020 and APR-2020. There is nothing changes kn style of posting and The period of both two inactivity is the same.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on January 30, 2023, 04:17:18 PMMaybe I missed something, did you ever post that address with that account?According to ninjastic.space he didn't share any address with that account. Without either that or access to email afaik nothing can be done to retrieve that account. Quote from: Gladitorcomeback on January 30, 2023, 04:19:46 PMIt will be better to provide some more information like when you post last message here and also You must have received the email change mail in your previous Email. You should provide this screenshot here so that moderators see your case properly.Since he said that he doesn't have access to that email I don't think that would work. But even if he had, I doubt that would serve as any sort of evidence since it can be faked.@Fleshslasher you claim in that first post that email has been changed, while bpip shows that it hasn't been changed. Are you 100% sure that you don't have access to that email address?

comments.author: Fleshslasher
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on January 30, 2023, 04:20:07 PMQuote from: rat03gopoh on January 30, 2023, 04:17:18 PMMaybe I missed something, did you ever post that address with that account?According to ninjastic.space he didn't share any address with that account. Without either that or access to email afaik nothing can be done to retrieve that account. @Fleshslasher you claim in that first post that email has been changed, while bpip shows that it hasn't been changed. Are you 100% sure that you don't have access to that email address? im sorry the email address is the same. the email address is blobbly@tutanota.com. he got access to my email and account. i used this address in the peculium ico campaign 0x5c567938a9e8C73B0a4FC9e131aeB7010b943921 but the spreadsheet for the campaign is deleted.here was the ico campaign peculium: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2368249.0

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:23:38 PM i used this address in the peculium ico campaign 0x5c567938a9e8C73B0a4FC9e131aeB7010b943921 but the spreadsheet for the campaign is deleted.here was the ico campaign peculium: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2368249.0Spreadsheet data are entered through Google form and anyone can fill wrong data and you said that spreadsheet is deleted. It's now clear that you are the real owner of this account and without any proof how Mod will decide in your favor?

comments.author: Fleshslasher
comments.body: Quote from: Gladitorcomeback on January 30, 2023, 04:47:41 PMQuote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:23:38 PM i used this address in the peculium ico campaign 0x5c567938a9e8C73B0a4FC9e131aeB7010b943921 but the spreadsheet for the campaign is deleted.here was the ico campaign peculium: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2368249.0Spreadsheet data are entered through Google form and anyone can fill wrong data and you said that spreadsheet is deleted. It's now clear that you are the real owner of this account and without any proof how Mod will decide in your favor?security logs ip change have all the details my friend. i alread said it the account is mostly used and created in the Netherlands if anyone have logic they can see that the accounts ip is now used by a weird country

comments.author: skarais
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on January 30, 2023, 04:20:07 PM@Fleshslasher you claim in that first post that email has been changed, while bpip shows that it hasn't been changed. Are you 100% sure that you don't have access to that email address?I'm not sure bpip records all changes regarding account security, and I don't think not all email changes from different accounts are recorded there at all.I hope I'm wrong about this assumption, but pay attention to this one problem. If I remember correctly, @jkoil has changed his email recently after he got his account back, but there is no record that he has changed email on bpip.

comments.author: Fleshslasher
comments.body: the email is the same email but i have lost access to it. He changed the password to the mail address. you can also see it a bit on the posting i always posted 2 sentences he is posting better shit posting with more sentences. but ye idk maybe he did change his email after he secured everything

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:49:26 PMsecurity logs ip change have all the details my friend. i alread said it the account is mostly used and created in the Netherlands if anyone have logic they can see that the accounts ip is now used by a weird countryPeople move around (and/or use VPN) so changed IP is not the proof enough that account changed hands. And most importantly, you don't have any solid proof that you are the original owner of that account.By the why, how come you waited for so long to report the hack?

comments.author: Fleshslasher
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on January 30, 2023, 04:59:05 PMQuote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:49:26 PMsecurity logs ip change have all the details my friend. i alread said it the account is mostly used and created in the Netherlands if anyone have logic they can see that the accounts ip is now used by a weird countryPeople move around (and/or use VPN) so changed IP is not the proof enough that account changed hands. And most importantly, you don't have any solid proof that you are the original owner of that account.By the why, how come you waited for so long to report the hack? i was away finished school, found work and i came simply back. Thats all

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:23:38 PM i used this address in the peculium ico campaignDoubtful on my side, the campaign you pointed requires an authentication post to join, while there are no archives whatsoever to prove you were ever involved in the campaign. I also somewhat agree with the comment below you. Idk the bounty conduciveness at that time, maybe using someone else's identity is common. Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:49:26 PMi alread said it the account is mostly used and created in the Netherlands if anyone have logic they can see that the accounts ip is now used by a weird countryAs I said that IP address isn't enough for recovery. Looks like there is no choice but to give up your account (if it really is yours)

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: If you created a secret question when registering and remember the answer to the question, you can try to recover the account through that feature and it would immediately lock the account, making it impossible for anyone to access it.After this, you can send an email to Support for hacked/lost accounts and wait for a feedback, your chances of proving ownership is slim as you neither have a signed message, or access to the original email.But the team is in a better position to give you support.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:52:29 PMthe email is the same email but i have lost access to it. He changed the password to the mail address. you can also see it a bit on the posting i always posted 2 sentences he is posting better shit posting with more sentences. but ye idk maybe he did change his email after he secured everything@tam31 didn't post any address in its posting history, it will make it more difficult for you to recover the account [if it is really hacked]. You won't get any help from the recovery team as long as you don't have signed message, so I guess this is tricky case. IP can change if you use TOR, it is not guarantee that the account has changed hands.If you have valid proof that the account has changed hands due to being hacked, then contact the recovery team instead of getting the thread. I hope they can handle your problem better.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: Upgrade00 on January 30, 2023, 09:16:27 PMIf you created a secret question when registering and remember the answer to the question, you can try to recover the account through that feature and it would immediately lock the account, making it impossible for anyone to access it.After this, you can send an email to Support for hacked/lost accounts and wait for a feedback, your chances of proving ownership is slim as you neither have a signed message, or access to the original email.But the team is in a better position to give you support.I don't think there is any way to recover his account without the staked address but with the secret question he can lock the account forever if I am not wrong so there is nothing wrong by giving it a try.How the email and account lost to someone or you just sold it now looking to claim it back?

comments.author: CryptoPanda
comments.body: The account in question has been inactive for over a week and before now hasn’t been very active on the forum. The account isn’t wearing a signature or selling a service so the current owner definitely isn’t monetizing the account which I believe is the reason why most people buy accounts. After reading that the OP doesn’t have access to his email used to create the account, I can’t help but think the OP may trolling, I suspect it could be the  same person  causing drama in Meta. What are the odds?

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:08:00 PMi lost the access to the too email but i can provide a eth address that i used on the tam31 accountIf you don't have access to the original email address used to register the account, then forget about it. Without a staked address, it's one of the requirements need to recover the accountQuote from: CryptoPanda on January 31, 2023, 11:31:31 PMThe account in question has been inactive for over a week and before now hasn’t been very active on the forum. The account isn’t wearing a signature or selling a service, so the current owner definitely isn’t monetizing the account which I believe is the reason why most people buy accounts. Can't an account buyer pause for a week minus participating in any signature?

comments.author: Xinarae*
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on January 30, 2023, 04:59:05 PMQuote from: Fleshslasher on January 30, 2023, 04:49:26 PMsecurity logs ip change have all the details my friend. i alread said it the account is mostly used and created in the Netherlands if anyone have logic they can see that the accounts ip is now used by a weird countryPeople move around (and/or use VPN) so changed IP is not the proof enough that account changed hands. And most importantly, you don't have any solid proof that you are the original owner of that account.By the why, how come you waited for so long to report the hack?I agree with you that changing ip with vpn can be a kind of drama but it seems to me that the account has been changed hands multiple times by the original owner.Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on January 31, 2023, 11:46:15 PMCan't an account buyer pause for a week minus participating in any signature?  Yes i hope with you that this is the right think account is change new hand or selling new person.
